item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, March 16, 2025 at 3:35 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Nash, I made a standalone note with single HTML file (203 points | 45 comments)
2. Finding Signal in the Noise: Machine Learning and the Markets (Jane Street) (76 points | 31 comments)
3. Sign in as anyone: Bypassing SAML SSO authentication with parser differentials (199 points | 73 comments)
4. Milk Kanban (311 points | 128 comments)
5. Wyvern's Open Satellite Feed (109 points | 2 comments)
6. Imagine an Agent that can hot-reload tools. Open-source (7 points | discuss)
7. ESP32 WiFi Superstitions (42 points | 26 comments)

9. Career Advice in 2025 (20 points | 4 comments)
10. Strengthening AI Agent Hijacking Evaluations (13 points | 2 comments)
11. Evidence that Neanderthal and Homo sapiens engaged in cultural exchange (63 points | 25 comments)
12. Lego says it wants to start to bring video game development in-house (48 points | 23 comments)
13. Show HN: A personal YouTube frontend based on yt-dlp (214 points | 134 comments)
14. Sunset Geometry (2016) (83 points | 10 comments)
15. Lemma for the Fundamental Theorem of Galois Theory (116 points | 29 comments)
16. Show HN: Aiopandas – Async .apply() and .map() for Pandas, Faster API/LLMs Calls (34 points | 6 comments)
17. Parahelp (YC S24) Is Hiring Founding Engineers (SF) ( | hide)
18. They're Close to My Body: A Hagiography of Nine Inch Nails and Robin Finck (2020) (95 points | 53 comments)
19. Apple's long-lost hidden recovery partition from 1994 has been found (7 points | discuss)
20. Computers and Mice – Mister Rogers Neighborhood (94 points | 26 comments)
21. What Bikini Atoll Looks Like Today (2017) (121 points | 51 comments)
22. AutoHete: An Automatic and Efficient Heterogeneous Training System for LLMs (27 points | discuss)
23. Arbitrary-Scale Super-Resolution with Neural Heat Fields (132 points | 44 comments)
24. So Long and Thanks for All the Words: A Toast to Douglas Adams (200 points | 73 comments)
25. A look at Firefox forks (506 points | 337 comments)
26. Briar: Peer to Peer Encrypted Messaging (406 points | 167 comments)
27. Show HN: Fashion Shopping with Nearest Neighbors (60 points | 20 comments)
28. RubyLLM: A delightful Ruby way to work with AI (603 points | 161 comments)
29. Show HN: Metacheck – preview how any link appears on social media and chat apps (130 points | 31 comments)
30. Transformers Without Normalization (237 points | 30 comments)
